Here's how it was before:

And here's the current version:

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1527250821425"},{"name":"updated","value":"1527673059258"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"maksimrv"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Maksim Ryzhikov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"jk"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Evgeny Naumenko"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"8"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JPS-8630","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Projects"],"valueId":["Projects"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 68","id":"YouTrack:sprint 68"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"74-528398","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image.png?file=74-528398&c=true"},{"value":"image1.png","id":"74-528399","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1.png?file=74-528399&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2888199","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Max Maximov can we pass custom template?
Because now I see that we can pass only strings - https://upsource.jetbrains.com/youtrack/file/970f19814cb3ee915640a6d6c6bd72bc1ac4db4a/charisma/youtrack-frontend/app/pages/projects/controller/projects.js?nav=742:831:focused&preview=false

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527251028974,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889252","author":"Maxim.Maximov","authorFullName":"Max Maximov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Maksim Ryzhikov, it's a quite hard to handle Angular stuff inside React component, so let's use React on the YouTrack side to solve this issue for now. And let's discuss it one more time to find a better decision after the release.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527273952185,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889257","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Max Maximov Ok, let's discuss it on Monday because use React inside angular also quite hard :)

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274234185,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889260","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Max Maximov as an example of good abstraction over React you can look at our alert service.
https://upsource.jetbrains.com/youtrack/file/ba2c5f36dc2ae3d5fb565e6140bdcea388695bed/charisma/youtrack-frontend/app/components/alert/service/yt-alert.js
https://upsource.jetbrains.com/youtrack/file/ba2c5f36dc2ae3d5fb565e6140bdcea388695bed/charisma/youtrack-frontend/app/components/alert/test/service/yt-alert.js
You can do similar stuff inside the project list

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274372412,"updated":1527274406207,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889265","author":"Maxim.Maximov","authorFullName":"Max Maximov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksim Ryzhikov, how about using JSX? Something like this:

        noProjectsFound: (
          <span>
            {i18n('There are no projects yet.')}
            <span>  </span>
            <Link>{i18n('Start with creating one')}</Link>
            <span> or </span>
            <Link>{i18n('Import from Jira')}</Link>
          </span>
        ),
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274656152,"updated":1527273952132,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889267","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Max Maximov nope, because two-way data binding doesn't work and handlers also don't work.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274801844,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2892928","author":"Maxim.Maximov","authorFullName":"Max Maximov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Fixed in Hub 2018.2.9650

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527602392285,"updated":1527274656102,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2894098","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Developers note:

Now we can use something like this:

<projects-list>
<not-found-template> Not found!</not-found-template>
<empty-template>No projects</empty-template>
</projects-list>

There is a long-standing issue about completing user name in the command window. The situation is even worse while adding new watchers via Watchers popup: since usernames aren't shown in the popup I cannot tell which user in the list is from our team even if I know his username:

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1521119690007"},{"name":"updated","value":"1527518816425"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"mitya"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Dmitry Gizatov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"nik"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Nikolay Chashnikov"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"votes","value":"4"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JT-46816","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"JT-13681","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"YTB-751","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 68","id":"YouTrack:sprint 68"}]},{"name":"voterName","value":[{"value":"Aleksey.Makarkin","fullName":"Aleksey Makarkin"},{"value":"mkuzmin","fullName":"Michael Kuzmin"},{"value":"sugdyzhekov","fullName":"Sergey Ugdyzhekov"},{"value":"Vitaly.Gordeev","fullName":"Vitaly Gordeev"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"74-502499","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image.png?file=74-502499&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2752607","author":"xi-eye","authorFullName":"Alexander Anisimov","issueId":"JT-46254","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1521120257888,"updated":1521120292928,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-46192","entityId":"25-1892167","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"46192"},{"name":"summary","value":"Experimenal Issue View – pin right (fields) pane"},{"name":"description","value":"

Hi!

We've enabled experimental view on our tracker. It's nice and all, but our QAs are not happy with the fact that they need to scroll all the way up to change fields on issue. Also writing a comment can redirect you to the top of the page.

Zalim Bashorov Most likely it's related to the insufficient permissions. I can see all buttons. Do you have any other projects, where you don't see these buttons?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1518792639935,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2711213","author":"jk","authorFullName":"Evgeny Naumenko","issueId":"JT-45817","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

That's correct, you don't have necessary permissions granted in Web project: https://hub.jetbrains.com/projects-administration/cf2bd329-6ba7-4e7f-b1ee-ecd9be34fc63?tab=access
One can request additional permissions by posting a ticket to ADM project.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1518792904985,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2711304","author":"Zalim.Bashorov","authorFullName":"Zalim Bashorov","issueId":"JT-45817","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527498483815,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"jetbrains-team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2890212","author":"xi-eye","authorFullName":"Alexander Anisimov","issueId":"JT-45817","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Zalim Bashorov as far as I can see you don't have permissions to change this issue.
In the new issue overview we decided not to show actions that user can't use.
That's why you don't see those action buttons.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527498916621,"updated":1527498943979,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2890372","author":"Zalim.Bashorov","authorFullName":"Zalim Bashorov","issueId":"JT-45817","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Which permissions do I need to run command and to add own tags? Actually, I can do both for the referenced issue, but just don't see buttons and I think it's a ui/usability issue.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527501086787,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-45673","entityId":"25-1863734","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"45673"},{"name":"summary","value":"All view buttons for activity stream can be turned off "},{"name":"description","value":"

Сurrent behavior
The last remaining active button can change the state to inactive.

Expected behavior
The last remaining active button should’t change its state.

Expl
Active only one any button eg comments, and I see comment below. If I click on this button, button should’t change its state, because otherwise the comment will not be visible.

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1518175332884"},{"name":"updated","value":"1527518179632"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"xi-eye"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexander Anisimov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mitya"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Dmitry Gizatov"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"3"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-751","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 68","id":"YouTrack:sprint 68"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"74-491769","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image.png?file=74-491769&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2703098","author":"xi-eye","authorFullName":"Alexander Anisimov","issueId":"JT-45673","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
There must always be at least one active button

Dmitry Gizatov which one? How should it be?

Please provide me with the scenario
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1518188255213,"updated":1518207346867,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2890065","author":"xi-eye","authorFullName":"Alexander Anisimov","issueId":"JT-45673","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Dmitry Gizatov i don't see a big problem here, because after reload you will have an expected button active.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527496405329,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2890094","author":"mitya","authorFullName":"Dmitry Gizatov","issueId":"JT-45673","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Alexander Anisimov It isn't a BIG problem, but it's abnormal behaviour of the standard element, it's bad for whole UX. And, I think it's not so difficult to do.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527496986921,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-44974","entityId":"25-1820198","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"44974"},{"name":"summary","value":"Permalink for the comment with attachments doesn't work on new FSI"},{"name":"description","value":"

When I click on permalink to the comment with the attachment it doesn't properly work.
Expected: as in old FSI the link will direct to the comment with attachments
What happens now: since attachments are not visible in the comment, the link directs to attachments in overview.

This is very critical for issues like: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/v2/issue/DSGN-4827

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1513769746344"},{"name":"updated","value":"1527518166163"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"xi-eye"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexander Anisimov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Natasha.Katson"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Natasha Katson"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"2"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JT-46145","type":"Duplicate","role":"is duplicated by"},{"value":"YTB-751","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 68","id":"YouTrack:sprint 68"}]},{"name":"voterName","value":[{"value":"Ivan.Chirkov","fullName":"Ivan Chirkov"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-46433","entityId":"25-1916634","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"46433"},{"name":"summary","value":"Project list in new issue details screen does not allow project ID for lookup"},{"name":"description","value":"
See screenshot
'Design and Artwork' project is DSGN and I can't find it by this id. Quite inconvenient

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527503864801,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-46367","entityId":"25-1908731","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"46367"},{"name":"summary","value":"Show fetch time as a timestamp for VCS change in an issue stream "},{"name":"description","value":"

  • targetMember = null - it's rule for all ADD activity, indicating that the vcs change was added itself, not as a change of some member of certain target

  • vcs_change.fetched == activity.timestamp - times when vcs change actually got to YouTrack, please use this time instead of vcs_change.date

  • vcs_change.date - timestamp of vcs change creation, nature of this time is external, so it can be used as a part of vcs change description, but not as a time of activity

1. Edit comment
2. Want to insert (cmd+c) an image in the comment text.
3. The image is uploading, it's said "uploaded" but it doesn't appear in the text.
4. Refresh the page, the image is attached but not in the text as it was supposed to.

!image.png!
"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1525957039671"},{"name":"updated","value":"1527517998683"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"xi-eye"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexander Anisimov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Natasha.Katson"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Natasha Katson"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JT-47238","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"YTB-866","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 68","id":"YouTrack:sprint 68"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"weird_edit_issue.gif","id":"74-522978","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/weird_edit_issue.gif?file=74-522978&c=true"},{"value":"image1526575207221.png","id":"74-525651","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1526575207221.png?file=74-525651&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2874258","author":"Andrey.Akinshin","authorFullName":"Andrey Akinshin","issueId":"JT-47151","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I have the following problem all the time:
1. I'm making a screenshot and copy it to clipboard.
2. I'm starting a new comment and paste it via Ctrl+V.
3. I see something like !image1526574919141.png! in the comment body.
4. There are 3 possible situation with the attachment:
a) I have !image1526574919141.png! in the attachment, everything is OK.
b) I have something like !image.png! in the attachment, so my !image1526574919141.png! can't be resolved. =(
c) No attachment. =(
!image1526574981848.png!
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526575166503,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2874262","author":"Andrey.Akinshin","authorFullName":"Andrey Akinshin","issueId":"JT-47151","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I tried to attach a screenshot to the previous comment without success. =(
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526575238700,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-46400","entityId":"25-1911775","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"46400"},{"name":"summary","value":"HTML not rendered in workflow.message() method"},{"name":"description","value":"

Prior to 2018.1, one could include at least some HTML as part of the string passed to the message() method. An example of this is in the default "Clone Issue" workflow, which calls message() with a string that includes an HTML link pointing to the new issue. As of 2018.1, this HTML is no longer rendered, yielding raw HTML in the message.

Thinking maybe the format of the messages was changed to Markdown, I tried including a link in the [something](http://something) format, and it, too, got rendered in the raw

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1521838385542"},{"name":"updated","value":"1527516744954"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"Anna.Zhdan"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Anna Zhdan"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"bobw"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bob Williams"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"8"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-751","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Affected versions","value":["2018.1"],"valueId":["2018.1"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 68","id":"YouTrack:sprint 68"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"message-with-markdown1.png","id":"74-506466","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/message-with-markdown1.png?file=74-506466&c=true"},{"value":"message-with-html1.png","id":"74-506467","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/message-with-html1.png?file=74-506467&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2773884","author":"jk","authorFullName":"Evgeny Naumenko","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Bob Williams would you mind attaching a screenshot?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1521894461753,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2780847","author":"bobw","authorFullName":"Bob Williams","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Two images are attached. Here's one showing the message when I used markdown:

And one showing the message when I used HTML:

Here are the relevant lines from the workflow that I'm using to generate the message (obviously, I created the two screenshots by alternately uncommenting the message assignment lines):

var message = "This issue has been continued to <a href='" + newIssue.url + "'>" + newIssue.id + "</a>. Don't forget to set the new issue's Release field as appropriate.";
//var message = "This issue has been continued to [" + newIssue.id + "](" + newIssue.url + "). Don't forget to set the new issue's Release field as appropriate.";
workflow.message(message);

And here's similar usage from the default Clone Issue workflow, which (mis)behaves the same way:

var newIssue = ctx.issue.createCopy(); // WARNING! Do not use this method in your workflows. Use Issue#copy() instead
workflow.message(workflow.i18n('A clone of the current issue has been created: <a href="{0}">{1}</a>', newIssue.url, newIssue.id));
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1522167869764,"updated":1522168187019,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2780851","author":"bobw","authorFullName":"Bob Williams","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

To be clear, what used to happen prior to 2018.1 is that the HTML link would render as a link, not as raw HTML source. In this case, the issue ID would show without the surrounding markup, and it would be blue underlined text that was clickable.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1522168026276,"updated":1522167869608,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2780873","author":"bobw","authorFullName":"Bob Williams","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Re-adding attachments

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1522168277696,"updated":1522168026061,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2796150","author":"Alexander.Volfman","authorFullName":"Alexander Volfman","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Bob Williams AFAIU, you see this in experimental issue view mode, is this the case?
The markdown have never been working in these messages, however, if you switch ot classic view, the HTML variant will be rendered just fine.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1522770829146,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2796178","author":"Alexander.Volfman","authorFullName":"Alexander Volfman","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
just to make it clear. I'm not suggesting to permanently switch on a classic view, but rather gathering propper STRs.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1522771297524,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2798968","author":"bobw","authorFullName":"Bob Williams","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Ah, you are correct. HTML works in classic view, while neither HTML nor markdown work in the new view. Good catch.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1522893049594,"updated":1522168277532,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2801855","author":"Alexander.Volfman","authorFullName":"Alexander Volfman","issueId":"JT-46400","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Markdown has never been supported, as for HTML support on the new issue screen, it will be added within several months.
